DRAWING UP THE CORONER'S CERTIFICATE AND THE CONTENTS THEREOF
(1) A coroner's certificate shall be drawn up based on data from the civil register, the central population register, the central database of rights from public funds and data provided by the family members of the deceased and the persons who lived with the deceased.
(2) If during the procedure for drawing up the coroner's certificate, a will or certificate of the deposit of a will was submitted to the registrar, or if the registrar was informed that a will exists, the registrar shall attach the will or the certificate of the deposit of a will to the coroner's certificate, or record in it the information about the existence of a will.
(3) A coroner's certificate shall be drawn up also when the deceased leaves no property.
